Package game

Class GameSingleton

java.lang.Object
game.GameSingleton
public class GameSingleton
extends java.lang.Object
A singleton class to manage the game. This class is the only way to access the member class of game from outside.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int HEIGHT
    The height (y axis) of the game map.
    static int WIDTH
    The width (x axis) of the game map.

  • Constructor Summary

      The width (x axis) of the game map.

      The height (y axis) of the game map.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameSingleton

      public GameSingleton()

  • Method Details

    • addBeing

      public static void addBeing​(Being being)
      Add a being to the game. Calls GameController.addEntity(entity.Entity) and BeingsManager.addBeing(Being).
      Parameters:
      being - The being to add.

    • removeBeing

      public static void removeBeing​(Being being)
      Remove a being from the game. Calls GameController.removeEntity(entity.Entity) and BeingsManager.removeBeing(Being).
      Parameters:
      being - The being to remove.

    • getTileObject

      public static StillObject getTileObject​(int x, int y)
      Get the object at the specified tile position.
      Parameters:
      x - The x position of the tile.
      y - THe y position of the tile.
      Returns:
      The object at the tile.

    • setTileObject

      public static void setTileObject​(int x, int y, StillObject object)
      Set the object at the specified tile position. This also calls GameController.queueTileRender(Tile) and BeingsManager.updateBeingsAroundTile(Tile).
      Parameters:
      x - The x position of the tile.
      y - THe y position of the tile.
      object - The object to put on the tile.

    • addPhantomEntity

      public static void addPhantomEntity​(PhantomEntity entity)
      Add a phantom entity (an unrendered background entity). Uses GameController.addEntity(entity.Entity).
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to add.

    • removePhantomEntity

      public static void removePhantomEntity​(PhantomEntity entity)
      Remove a phantom entity. Uses GameController.removeEntity(entity.Entity).
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to remove.

    • getActiveKeys

      public static java.util.HashSet<javafx.scene.input.KeyCode> getActiveKeys()
      Get the set of currently pressed keyboard keys. Used for key polling.
      Returns:
      The set of currently pressed keyboard keys
      See Also:
      Player.update(double)

    • moveBeing

      public static boolean moveBeing​(Being being, double dx, double dy)
      Move a being. Uses BeingsManager.moveBeing(Being, double, double).
      Parameters:
      being - The being to move.
      dx - The x axis position difference.
      dy - The y axis position difference.
      Returns:
      Whether or not the move was successful.

    • initialize

      public static void initialize​(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
      Prepare the GameSingleton.
      Parameters:
      pane - The Pane to use for game UIs and canvases.

    • start

      public static void start​(boolean createGameplayManager)
      Start or restart the game. Build UIs and canvas layers. Initialize all fields except rootPane.
      Parameters:
      createGameplayManager - Whether or not to set up with GameplayManager. True for actual games. False if you just want a map with monsters moving (see HomeScreen).

    • destroy

      public static void destroy()
      End the game. Uses GameController.stop().

    • pause

      public static void pause()
      Pause the game. Uses GameController.pause().

    • resume

      public static void resume()
      Resume the game. Uses GameController.resume().
